articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Palestinians voiced wariness on Tuesday toward a U.S.-backed foundation set to bring aid to Gaza amid signs of famine, with Hamas warnings about biometric screening procedures keeping many away from distribution points.
articles.title: Palestinians wary as US-backed aid group begins operations in Gaza

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Russian forces have captured four villages in Ukraine's northeastern Sumy region, the local governor said, the latest battlefield setback for Kyiv as it seeks to hold territory and avoid handing Moscow the advantage in any peace talks.
articles.title: Russia seizes villages in northern Ukraine, drone attacks ease

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: The contacts mark a significant development in ties between the two countries.
articles.title: Exclusive: Syria and Israel in direct talks focused on security, sources say

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: The U.S. will not seek the death penalty for a son of convicted Mexican drug kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman, Joaquin Guzman Lopez, if he is convicted on U.S. drug trafficking charges of his own, prosecutors said in a court filing.
articles.title: El Chapo's son Guzman Lopez would not get death penalty if convicted, US says

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The move comes as the Trump administration has sought to ramp up deportations and revoke student visas as part of his hardline immigration agenda.
articles.title: Trump administration halts scheduling of new student visa appointments

articles.author: Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: One of three judges in Diego Maradona's closely scrutinized homicide trial in Argentina resigned on Tuesday amid a scandal triggered by the alleged filming of an unauthorized documentary, bringing uncertainty to the future of legal proceedings.
articles.title: Diego Maradona trial judge stands down amid scandal

articles.author: Sarah Marsh, Matthias Williams, Thomas Escritt
articles.description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz delivered his most severe rebuke of Israel to date, criticising massive air strikes on Gaza as no longer justified by the need to fight Hamas and "no longer comprehensible".
articles.title: Germany shifts tone on Israel over 'incomprehensible' Gaza carnage

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: President Donald Trump's administration asked the U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday to intervene in its effort to rapidly deport migrants to countries other than their own without the opportunity to raise claims that they fear being persecuted, tortured or killed there.
articles.title: Trump asks US Supreme Court to intervene in deportations to third countries

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian air defences destroyed or intercepted 112 Ukrainian drones over a three-hour period, most of them over central or southern regions, the Russian Defence Ministry said early on Wednesday.
articles.title: Air defences down 112 Ukrainian drones over Russia, 8 headed to Moscow, officials say

articles.author: A.J. Vicens
articles.description: An Iranian national pleaded guilty to participating in the high-profile 2019 Baltimore, Maryland, ransomware attack, among others, and to causing tens of millions of dollars in losses and disrupted services, the Department of Justice said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Iranian man pleads guilty in US to 2019 Baltimore ransomware attack
